title: The Last of Us Part 2 developer 'hears the concerns' over homophobia in latest trailer
text:
The Last of Us Part 2 director Neil Druckmann has addressed accusations his forthcoming game panders to misogynistic and/or homophobic tropes.

Some fans on social media reacted angrily to scenes in the game’s latest trailer, released earlier this week, from which they inferred its plot centred around teenage heroine Ellie’s quest to avenge the death of her girlfriend, Dina.

Tweets from angry gamers accused developers Naughty Dog of ‘fridging’ - a term coined by comic book author Gail Simone to describe a plot device where women are victimised in order specifically to develop a male character, and which takes its name from a 1994 Green Lantern comic in which the superhero returns home returns home to discovers his girlfriend has been murdered and literally packed into his fridge.

Others referenced the equally unpleasant ‘bury your gays’ cliche in which homosexual characters in mainstream entertainment properties are seen as more expendable than their heterosexual counterparts.

’The Last of Us: PART WAYS BECAUSE WE BURY OUR GAYS’ proclaimed @GawkingGeek on Twitter. ‘Extremely disappointed here. Even if that’s the full story in the game, the trailer is nothing buy a big, pixelated fridging’.
description: The Last of Us Part 2 director Neil Druckmann has addressed accusations his forthcoming game panders to misogynistic and/or homophobic tropes.
